Sure, here are some tips for writing a standout personal statement for the Master's programme at the University of Oxford:

1. Start with a strong opening: Grab the attention of the reader with a strong opening sentence or paragraph that clearly states why you are a good fit for the Master's programme.

2. Showcase your academic background: Your academic background is an essential part of your personal statement. Highlight your academic qualifications, past achievements, and any relevant coursework that demonstrates your suitability and expertise for the programme.

3. Demonstrate your research interests: The Oxford Master's programme is research-oriented, so it’s essential to highlight your research interests and explain the direction you want to take in your research during the programme.

4. Show your enthusiasm: Your personal statement should convey your passion for the subject and why you are excited about pursuing the Master's degree at Oxford. Discuss the specific aspects of the programme that excite you the most, and why you have chosen to study your chosen discipline.

5. Draw on your experience: Discuss any relevant work, research or volunteer experience that showcases your ability to succeed in the Oxford Master's programme.

6. Be specific: Provide specific examples and results of your academic achievements and experience that demonstrate your potential for success.

7. Be concise: Try to write a coherent and concise statement that covers all the critical points mentioned above, and is no longer than two A4 pages.

Remember to proofread and edit your personal statement for grammar, spelling, and punctuation errors before submitting your application. Good luck with your application!
